title: James T. Kirk
author: Tom W. Hartung
card_content_html: This image of James T. Kirk, Captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise in the Original Star Trek series, shows he is decisive and cool under pressure. These are good traits for a leader to have — uncertainty and a tendency to be emotional are not qualities that typically inspire followers.
card_first_person_html:
The profiles and images of the three main characters in the Original Star Trek series — Kirk, Spock, and McCoy — were among the first I did back in the 1980s, so it makes sense they should be among the first posted on this site.

Initially, it was a bit surprising to see how similar Captain Kirk's imge is to Mr. Spock's, in that both portraits contain a substantial amount of Green. It's also important to note how this portrait shows Kirk is more outgoing than Spock — one of the qualities which helps make him a good leader, while making it difficult to see Spock in a similar position.
